meanings.definition: A structure that can give rise to a new individual or colony
meanings.sent1: The propagules of the plant were carefully collected for propagation.
meanings.sent2: The dispersal of propagules ensures the survival of the species.
meanings.sent3: The propagules decided to have a race to see who could grow into a plant first.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like propagules, spreading and taking root in the minds of others.
meanings.sent5: The propagules floated in the wind, ready to start new life wherever they landed.

meanings.definition: A reproductive structure capable of developing into a new plant or organism
meanings.sent1: Each propagule contains the genetic information needed for growth.
meanings.sent2: The propagules released by the tree will soon sprout into seedlings.
meanings.sent3: The propagules threw a party to celebrate their potential to become plants.
meanings.sent4: His words were like propagules, taking root in the hearts of those who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The propagules held the promise of a lush garden waiting to bloom.
